globalEvents.name: Open Crate 1
globalEvents.eventText:
You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

entityProperties.name: Crate1
entityProperties.theText: An old supply crate.

globalEvents.name: Open Crate 2
globalEvents.eventText:
You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

entityProperties.name: Crate2
entityProperties.theText: An old supply crate.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

entityProperties.theText: An old supply crate.

globalEvents.name: Mission Briefing
globalEvents.eventText:
A frantic distress call has brought you back to the settlement, already under Imperial occupation while soldiers ransack homes. 

{-} Deploy the heroes to the blue highlighted space.

eventActions.theText: A checkpoint lies in front of the section you wish to enter, and Imperial forces stand guard.

entityProperties.name: Barricade 1
entityProperties.theText:
The Imperial forces have erected a checkpoint to keep any helpers out of the settlement.

{-} The 4 neutral mission tokens represent one barricade. A Rebel figure can attack the barricade (Health: 8, Defense: 1 {G}). The barricade is blocking terrain.

entityProperties.name: Barricade 2
entityProperties.theText:
The Imperial forces have erected a checkpoint to keep any helpers out of the settlement.

{-} The 4 neutral mission tokens represent one barricade. A Rebel figure can attack the barricade (Health: 8, Defense: 1 {G}). The barricade is blocking terrain.

entityProperties.name: Barricade 3
entityProperties.theText:
The Imperial forces have erected a checkpoint to keep any helpers out of the settlement.

{-} The 4 neutral mission tokens represent one barricade. A Rebel figure can attack the barricade (Health: 8, Defense: 1 {G}). The barricade is blocking terrain.

entityProperties.name: Barricade 4
entityProperties.theText:
The Imperial forces have erected a checkpoint to keep any helpers out of the settlement.

{-} The 4 neutral mission tokens represent one barricade. A Rebel figure can attack the barricade (Health: 8, Defense: 1 {G}). The barricade is blocking terrain.

eventActions.theText: {-} The 4 neutral mission tokens represent one barricade. A Rebel figure can attack the barricade (Health: 8, Defense: 1 {G}). The barricade is blocking terrain.
The noise of the battle has alerted local wildlife. A huge, white-furred creature approaches, roaring menacingly.

From Haven, you can hear screams for help as the Imperial forces march through the settlement.

{-} Doors are locked. An Imperial figure can attack a door (Health: 5, Defense: None).
{-} A door adjacent to a Rebel figure does not block his movement, line of sight, adjacency, or counting spaces.
{-} Rebel mission tokens represent refugees. A refugee can be attacked (Health: 3, Defense: 1 white die). Apply +1 Health to each refugee if there is a Boon in the heroes’ play area. When a refugee is defeated, click the refugee and select "Refugee Defeated".
{-} If there is a healthy Rebel figure on or adjacent to a refugee when it is attacked, apply +1 {G} to the defense results and the heroes may reroll the refugee's defense die.

You raise your weapons and storm forward to protect the settlers who have sheltered you for so long.

{-} As long as the barricade is intact, the Empire will shoot refugees at the end of each Round.
{-} The mission will progress when the barricade is destroyed.
{-} The Rebels lose when all refugees have been defeated.

{-} Doors are locked. An Imperial figure can attack a door (Health: 5, Defense: None).
{-} A door adjacent to a Rebel figure does not block his movement, line of sight, adjacency, or counting spaces.
{-} The 4 neutral mission tokens represent one barricade. A Rebel figure can attack the barricade (Health: 8, Defense: 1 {G}). The barricade is blocking terrain.
{-} Rebel mission tokens represent refugees. A refugee can be attacked (Health: 3, Defense: 1 white die). Apply +1 Health to each refugee if there is a Boon in the heroes’ play area. When a refugee is defeated, click the refugee and select "Refugee Defeated".
{-} If there is a healthy Rebel figure on or adjacent to a refugee when it is attacked, apply +1 {G} to the defense results and the heroes may reroll the refugee's defense die.
{-} As long as the barricade is intact, the Empire will shoot refugees at the end of each Round.
{-} The mission will progress when the barricade is destroyed.
{-} The Rebels lose when all refugees have been defeated.

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels win
globalEvents.eventText:
“Fall back!” the Imperial troops shout to each other after seeing their comrades defeated and their commander fall.

{-} The Rebels win the mission!
{-} Each hero receives 2 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.
{-} If the barricade was destroyed before the end of Round 3, heroes receive 100 credits per hero. Otherwise, increase the threat level of the next mission (and only the next mission) by 1. During the Rebel Upgrade stage, the Rebel players can decide to spend 50 credits per hero to prevent this.

eventActions.theText:
After the battle, you find Benex tending to his wounded citizens. “This is your fault,” he says through clenched teeth. “We risk our lives sheltering you, and you can't even be here to help when they...” he trails off, lowering his head.

A somber discussion ensues, and he even apologizes for blaming you. There’s the slightest sense of lingering animosity, however, as you spend the next several hours discussing your next steps.

{-} Place Story Mission card “Return to Echo Base” into play.

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels lose
globalEvents.eventText:
You eventually manage to drive the Imperial troops out, but heavy losses are inflicted upon the settlement and its people. In the aftermath, you walk through the desolation, wondering how long it will be before the Empire returns to finish its task.

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.
{-} Each hero receives 1 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.
{-} If the barricade was destroyed before the end of Round 3, heroes receive 100 credits per hero. Otherwise, increase the threat level of the next mission (and only the next mission) by 1. During the Rebel Upgrade stage, the Rebel players can decide to spend 50 credits per hero to prevent this.

eventActions.theText:
After the battle, you find Benex tending to his wounded citizens. “This is your fault,” he says through clenched teeth. “We risk our lives sheltering you, and you can't even be here to help when they...” he trails off, lowering his head.

A somber discussion ensues, and he even apologizes for blaming you. There’s the slightest sense of lingering animosity, however, as you spend the next several hours discussing your next steps.

{-} Place Story Mission card “Return to Echo Base” into play.

globalEvents.name: Open Door Storehouse
globalEvents.eventText: The door to the storehouse collapses under the Imperial attacks, revealing the shelf-lined interior.

entityProperties.name: Door Storehouse
entityProperties.theText:
A sturdy door leads into Haven's storehouse.

{-} The door is locked. An Imperial figure can attack a door (Health: 5, Defense: None).

globalEvents.name: Open Door Workshop
globalEvents.eventText: The door to the workshop collapses under the Imperial attacks. The inside is littered with droid parts, tools and workbenches.

entityProperties.name: Door Workshop
entityProperties.theText:
Behind the rusty door lies Haven's droid workshop.

{-} The door is locked. An Imperial figure can attack a door (Health: 5, Defense: None).

globalEvents.name: Open Door Control Room
globalEvents.eventText: The door to the control room collapses under the Imperial attacks. Monitors and data stations control the various systems of Haven, now vulnerable to the Empire.

entityProperties.name: Door Control Room
entityProperties.theText:
The door to Haven's control room has recently been renewed, but won't withstand the Imperials for long.

{-} The door is locked. An Imperial figure can attack a door (Health: 5, Defense: None).

globalEvents.name: Open Door Clinic
globalEvents.eventText: The door to the clinic collapses under the Imperial attacks. Bacta tanks and sickbeds are bathed in dim emergency twilight.

entityProperties.name: Door Clinic
entityProperties.theText:
Haven's small clinic is proteced by a door created from old spaceship scrap.

{-} The door is locked. An Imperial figure can attack a door (Health: 5, Defense: None).

globalEvents.name: The Raid
globalEvents.eventText: Under your attacks, the checkpoint barricades finally collapse, freeing the way into Haven.

entityProperties.name: Barricade 1
entityProperties.theText:
The Imperial forces have erected a checkpoint to keep any helpers out of the settlement.

{-} The 4 neutral mission tokens represent one barricade. A Rebel figure can attack the barricade (Health: 8, Defense: 1 {G}). The barricade is blocking terrain.

entityProperties.name: Barricade 2
entityProperties.theText:
The Imperial forces have erected a checkpoint to keep any helpers out of the settlement.

{-} The 4 neutral mission tokens represent one barricade. A Rebel figure can attack the barricade (Health: 8, Defense: 1 {G}). The barricade is blocking terrain.

entityProperties.name: Barricade 3
entityProperties.theText:
The Imperial forces have erected a checkpoint to keep any helpers out of the settlement.

{-} The 4 neutral mission tokens represent one barricade. A Rebel figure can attack the barricade (Health: 8, Defense: 1 {G}). The barricade is blocking terrain.

entityProperties.name: Barricade 4
entityProperties.theText:
The Imperial forces have erected a checkpoint to keep any helpers out of the settlement.

{-} The 4 neutral mission tokens represent one barricade. A Rebel figure can attack the barricade (Health: 8, Defense: 1 {G}). The barricade is blocking terrain.

eventActions.theText: All other figures: Block access to the refugees.
As you fight your way through the rubble, you finally see the leader of the Imperial forces. Commander Jann is standing right next to a gun emplacement.

enemyGroupData.customText:
{-} Imperial figures will attack a door if it is the shortest direct way to their target.
{A} ORDER: Another Imperial figure with a figure cost of 6 or less that can perform an attack attacks {rebel}.
{Q} If this figure did not use ORDER, move 3 to attack {rebel}.
{Q} Move 1 to attack {rebel}.
{A} Move 4 to engage a friendly TROOPER or GUARDIAN.
{-} COWER: If adjacent to another Imperial figure, recover 2 {H}. The adjacent non-<color="red">Focused</color> Imperial figure with the highest figure cost becomes <color="red">Focused</color>.
{-} This figure activates twice. After this figure finishes the instruction list, begin again from the top of the list. Limit once per activation.

eventActions.theText: {-} Imperial figures will attack a door if it is the shortest direct way to their target.

{-} When an attack targeting Commander Jann is declared, if there is an adjacent friendly TROOPER or GUARDIAN who could become the target of that attack, that figure becomes the target of that attack.
{-} Commander Jann activates twice, the second time right after the first time.
{-} The Rebels win when Commander Jann is defeated.

{-} Doors are locked. An Imperial figure can attack a door (Health: 5, Defense: None).
{-} A door adjacent to a Rebel figure does not block his movement, line of sight, adjacency, or counting spaces.
{-} Rebel mission tokens represent refugees. A refugee can be attacked (Health: 3, Defense: 1 white die). Apply +1 Health to each refugee if there is a Boon in the heroes’ play area. When a refugee is defeated, click the refugee and select "Refugee Defeated".
{-} If there is a healthy Rebel figure on or adjacent to a refugee when it is attacked, apply +1 {G} to the defense results and the heroes may reroll the refugee's defense die.
{-} When an attack targeting Commander Jann is declared, if there is an adjacent friendly TROOPER or GUARDIAN who could become the target of that attack, that figure becomes the target of that attack.
{-} Commander Jann activates twice, the second time right after the first time.
{-} The Rebels win when Commander Jann is defeated.
{-} The Rebels lose when all refugees have been defeated.

globalEvents.name: Defeat Refugee 1
globalEvents.eventText: Garsk is quickly gunned down by the Imperials, collapsing into the shelves of his storehouse.

entityProperties.name: Refugee 1
entityProperties.theText:
Garsk Leadira, the Bothan quartermaster of Haven, is trying to hide between the shelves of the warehouse.

{-} A refugee can be attacked (Health: 3, Defense: 1 white die). Apply +1 Health to each refugee if there is a Boon in the heroes’ play area. When a refugee is defeated, click "refugee defeated".
{-} If there is a healthy Rebel figure on or adjacent to a refugee when it is attacked, apply +1 {G} to the defense results and the heroes may reroll the refugee's defense die.

globalEvents.name: Defeat Refugee 2
globalEvents.eventText: Dix Gazzy hurls themself at the Imperial forces, but is hit by multiple blaster bolts. Nothing but a sharp hiss escapes from under the mask as Dix collapses.

entityProperties.name: Refugee 2
entityProperties.theText:
Dix Gazzy, one of the storehouse workers, has grabbed a steel pipe, ready to defend the storehouse from the Imperials, but their hands are shaking.

{-} A refugee can be attacked (Health: 3, Defense: 1 white die). Apply +1 Health to each refugee if there is a Boon in the heroes’ play area.
{-} If there is a healthy Rebel figure on or adjacent to a refugee when it is attacked, apply +1 {G} to the defense results and the heroes may reroll the refugee's defense die.

globalEvents.name: Defeat Refugee 3
globalEvents.eventText: "This is Haven! We're under attack! We need he-" Aora's message is cut short as Imperial shots gun the Twi'lek down.

entityProperties.name: Refugee 3
entityProperties.theText:
Aora Ktiro, the Twi'lek mechanic, is furiously working on what looks like an emergency signal in her hands, trying to summon more help.

{-} A refugee can be attacked (Health: 3, Defense: 1 white die). Apply +1 Health to each refugee if there is a Boon in the heroes’ play area.
{-} If there is a healthy Rebel figure on or adjacent to a refugee when it is attacked, apply +1 {G} to the defense results and the heroes may reroll the refugee's defense die.

globalEvents.name: Defeat Refugee 4
globalEvents.eventText: Ravlar fights bravely, holding the Imperials back as long as she can. Finally, a blaster bolt hits her square in the chest, and she falls.

entityProperties.name: Refugee 4
entityProperties.theText:
The Mikkian Ravlar Nrelam, one of your fellow Alliance fighters who has sought refuge in Haven, is grabbing her blaster pistol, aiming at the door.

{-} A refugee can be attacked (Health: 3, Defense: 1 white die). Apply +1 Health to each refugee if there is a Boon in the heroes’ play area.
{-} If there is a healthy Rebel figure on or adjacent to a refugee when it is attacked, apply +1 {G} to the defense results and the heroes may reroll the refugee's defense die.

globalEvents.name: Defeat Refugee 5
globalEvents.eventText: Thoss throws himself forward, trying to shield his daughter with his body. He is quickly caught in the crossfire and falls with one last frightened shout.

entityProperties.name: Refugee 5
entityProperties.theText:
Thoss Jeyanga, the Rodian computer administrator of the settlement, is desperately trying to keep the failing security systems running.

{-} A refugee can be attacked (Health: 3, Defense: 1 white die). Apply +1 Health to each refugee if there is a Boon in the heroes’ play area.
{-} If there is a healthy Rebel figure on or adjacent to a refugee when it is attacked, apply +1 {G} to the defense results and the heroes may reroll the refugee's defense die.

globalEvents.name: Defeat Refugee 6
globalEvents.eventText: An accidental metallic clang from Ehta's hiding place draws the Empire's attention. They fire a barrage of shots into the wall, and you hear something heavy dropping to the ground.

entityProperties.name: Refugee 6
entityProperties.theText:
Ehta, Thoss's young daughter, is trying to hide behind a maintenance panel in the wall.

{-} A refugee can be attacked (Health: 3, Defense: 1 white die). Apply +1 Health to each refugee if there is a Boon in the heroes’ play area.
{-} If there is a healthy Rebel figure on or adjacent to a refugee when it is attacked, apply +1 {G} to the defense results and the heroes may reroll the refugee's defense die.

globalEvents.name: Defeat Refugee 7
globalEvents.eventText: Jag tries to sit up and grab something to use as a weapon, but before he can get his hands on something, the Imperial soldiers gun him down.

entityProperties.name: Refugee 7
entityProperties.theText:
Jag Flari, a Weequay miner recently hurt in a mining accident, is still recovering from his injuries, unable to flee by himself.

{-} A refugee can be attacked (Health: 3, Defense: 1 white die). Apply +1 Health to each refugee if there is a Boon in the heroes’ play area.
{-} If there is a healthy Rebel figure on or adjacent to a refugee when it is attacked, apply +1 {G} to the defense results and the heroes may reroll the refugee's defense die.

globalEvents.name: Defeat Refugee 8
globalEvents.eventText: Dr. Rinsen doesn't even turn as the Imperial soldiers close in on her. She just closes her eyes. No sound escapes her as the shots hit her in the back.

entityProperties.name: Refugee 8
entityProperties.theText:
Zoryari Rinsen, the mute Savarian doctor, is tending to a couple of patients in the bacta tanks, completely unfazed by the fight outside.

{-} A refugee can be attacked (Health: 3, Defense: 1 white die). Apply +1 Health to each refugee if there is a Boon in the heroes’ play area.
{-} If there is a healthy Rebel figure on or adjacent to a refugee when it is attacked, apply +1 {G} to the defense results and the heroes may reroll the refugee's defense die.

globalEvents.name: Bomb Option 1
globalEvents.eventText: Mechanical pulsing precedes a Viper Probe Droid floating over the hill, joining the other Imperial forces.

globalEvents.name: Bomb Option 2
globalEvents.eventText:
“Get down!” you hear an Imperial commander shout before a small grenade lands in your midst. You scramble away as an earsplitting sonic blast sends you sprawling.

{-} Each hero suffers 1 {C} for each activation token he has and becomes <color="red">Weakened</color>.

globalEvents.name: Bomb Option 3
globalEvents.eventText:
A frag grenade lands right at your position and detonates, sending shrapnel and other fragments in every direction.

{-} Choose the space within 2 spaces of the most Rebel figures, then roll 1 red die. Each Rebel figure within 2 spaces of that space suffers {H} equal to the {H} results.

entityProperties.theText: An old supply crate.

entityProperties.theText: An old supply crate.
